titleStmt.title: The prayse of all women, called Mulieru[m] pean Very fruytfull and delectable vnto all the reders. Loke [et] rede who that can. This boke is prayse to eche woman.
titleStmt.author: Gosynhyll, Edward.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A17967 of text S107499 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 4626). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 51 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 21 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The prayse of all women, called Mulieru[m] pean Very fruytfull and delectable vnto all the reders. Loke [et] rede who that can. This boke is prayse to eche woman.
titleStmt.author: Gosynhyll, Edward.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Fletestrete at the sygne of the George by me wyllyam Myddylton,

notesStmt.note: The author's name, Edward Gosynhyll, appears in acrostics on E3v-E4r and in full on E4r.
A reply to: The schole house of women.
Printer's name and address from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
